thankyou_screens.title: Done! Your information was sent perfectly.

fields.title: Our family books tell the story of your child at the heart of your family. The This Story book builder will take you through the book, chapter by chapter, asking questions that can be answered quickly and prompting you to upload images. Let's start with the cover
Cover
What is your child's first name?

properties.description: This will appear in the title on the cover and throughout the book

properties.description: For example: 'Ayaan Rafiq', 'Bella' or 'James William Campbell'

fields.title: Dedication

Let's move onto the dedication. It's going to read

_*'Dear*_ {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}}_*,*_

_*Like every person, every family has its own story, which shapes who we are. This book is for you, and tells the story of how our family came to be.'*_
Are you making this book as a birthday present, and would you like to mention this in the dedication?
For which birthday is it?
How would you like to sign the dedication?

properties.description:
For example: 'Your Mummy and Daddy', 'Your Mom', 'Your loving parents'

Please note that you can add your full names in the next question

fields.title: Would you also like to include your (and your partner's if you have one) given and/or full names under the dedication?
Please add your (and your partner's if you have one) given/full names, here

properties.description: For example: 'Jonathan Williams and Aamaal Williams-Morad', or 'Celeste and Tracy'

fields.title: Please let us know your location in a way {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} would understand

properties.description: For example 'Winchester', 'Hackney', or 'Twinkle Cottage'

fields.title: Which month would you like to put?
And which year?

fields.title: Tailoring your questionnaire
Families come in all shapes and sizes, so we'll now ask you a few questions that will allow us to put a questionnaire together that suits your family.
Was {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} adopted?

choices.label: Yes, as part of a surrogacy agreement
Yes, via the local authority or adoption agency

fields.title:
We would love to work with you, but please be aware that our book would be in addition to, and not instead of, an adoption life book. Creating an adoption life book is an ongoing and important process, involving adopters, foster parents, social worker and the adopted child. 

*For more information and help with an adoption life book, you can visit*
*https://ccsadoption.org/sharing-stories/*
How many parents and/or carers are in your family?

choices.label: Co-parenting family with two, three or more parents and/or carers
More information on the different versions

fields.title: How did your family come to be?

choices.label: I decided to start a family on my own
I was with somebody but we separated

fields.title: Is the other parent sill in the child's life

properties.description: Does {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} still see the other parent on a regular or semi-regular basis? Please answer 'yes', even if it is just once or twice a year and the child is aware of them

fields.title: Are you still with the same partner, you conceived the child with?
Did one of the parents pass away?

So we could best tell the stories of all families, we have  versions for different types of families

*•* *Two-parent family with the same partner then and now*
*• Co-parenting family by design, or with an ex-partner, who is in the child's life*
*• One-parent family by design, or if the other parent is completely absent*

Please read the information below to make sure you choose the right version

*Two-parent family with the same partner then and now*

This version is for two-parent families, where two partners conceived a child together and are still parenting as a couple, who are the main care givers. This version does allow you to  include children from previous relationships, though.

It has a linear structure, starting with the grandparents (if you so wish), gives some background of both parents, including siblings and hobbies as well as how {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} came to be. It then continues with the child's first few years and the family's life.

If you would like to include somebody else as a main carer, for example a grandparent, long-standing nanny, or a gamete donor you may want to choose the co-parenting version, which based on what we call a 'cast list', that allows to show {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} with different households. It still tells the story of your child came to be, though.

*Co-parenting family by design, or with an ex-partner, who is in the child's life*

This version celebrates that families come in all shapes and sizes. It's for you if for example a donor is involved in the parenting, if you don't live with the partner you conceived {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} with and/or if have met somebody new, or if grandparents regularly care for {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}}. This version is the most flexible and also works if you're making this book for a step or grand child. 

Rather than telling your story in a linear way, it focusses on the child and the people who are close to them, and works more like a cast list, choosing to focus on the people who shape the child's life, while still containing the narrative of how your child came to be, though.

*One-parent family by design, or if the other parent is completely absent*

This version is designed for one-parent families, whether they were planned as such, or if there was a partner who is now completely out of the picture. 

It also tells your family's story in a linear way, starting with your parents (if you so wish) work and hobbies. It moves onto how {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}} came to be, as well as {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}}'s first few years and family life.

Please note that this version is only for one-parent families by design, or where the other parent is completely absent and/or unknown. It's *not* for families, where another parent (and/or donor) is involved in the parenting - even if the contact is sporadic and/or short - if this is the case, please choose 'co-parenting family'. Psychologists are unanimous that  it's in the interest of the child to include even a semi-absent parent as best as they can, as they are still an important piece of the child's identity. 

If you'd like to be able to give more space to a grandparent, or very long-standing nanny, you may want to opt for the co-parenting version. This version also includes a narrative, but is based on what we call a 'cast list', that gives spaces to the important people in your child's life.

Our questionnaires come in two versions - conventional and genderless language. 

The *conventional version* uses words like 'mother', sister/brother, and aunt. It also uses he/she and, for example, assumes that brothers are male and use male pronouns

The *genderless version* replaces all gendered words. It will use for example 'birthing parent' instead of 'mother', 'sibling', instead of 'brother'/'sister' and 'auncle' instead of 'aunt/uncle'. All pronouns are they/them
Would you like to use conventional or genderless language?

Great! You have chosen to make a book for your adopted child {{field:efd45ed6-1275-47b6-9a8b-30ab0dda2b41}}, using conventional language. Could you confirm this is correct?
